sentence.text: FRG1 regulates various muscle-related functions, but studies have proposed its role in development and angiogenesis also, where it is involved with tumor-associated molecules.
Therefore, we decided to look into its role in tumor progression, tumor angiogenesis, and its impact on cellular properties.
Further, immunohistochemistry was done to identify FRG1 expression levels in various cancers and its association with tumor angiogenesis.
Immunohistochemistry analysis showed reduced FRG1 levels in tumors which were supported by in silico analysis data.
These findings suggest that reduction in FRG1 expression in gastric, colon and oral cavity tumor might have a role in tumor progression, by regulating cell migration and invasiveness.
